text:
The Rustaceans are making all the cool command-line tools. Just now, someone released a multithreaded and SIMD-parallelized tool to uwu-fy source text. It's capable of making your source text kawaii at gigabytes per second:
<https://github.com/Daniel-Liu-c0deb0t/uwu>
It's just a matter of time before Daniel Lemire postd about it on his blog

elements.text: The Rustaceans are making all the cool command-line tools. Just now, someone released a multithreaded and SIMD-parallelized tool to uwu-fy source text. It's capable of making your source text kawaii at gigabytes per second:
It's just a matter of time before Daniel Lemire postd about it on his blog

text: I've been spending some time in the Rust community and its pretty great, like lots of "passion projects", maybe more goofing around then there ought to be, but yea Rust has really opened up a doorway for people to mess around with things they otherwise wouldn't. Systems programming as a hobby actually has a pretty large population now days haha
